newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian M2 money supply rises 66 pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Romanian M2 money supply rises 66 pct in 1996.

text.p: Romania's M2 money supply rose by a year-on-year 66 percent last December when it stood at 30.34 trillion lei, National Bank (BNR) data showed.
M2, which is Romania's measure of broad money supply, soared by a monthly 9.6 percent in December after November's 6.8 percent increase.

The M1 narrow money, which includes currency outside banks and demand deposits, expanded by 57.7 percent last year to stand at 11.17 trillion lei, with cash in circulation up to 5.38 trillion lei from 3.76 trillion in 1995.
Year-end bonuses triggered a 10.9 percent monthly rise of the cash in circulation last December, when demand deposits grew by 8.9 percent from November.
Household savings saw a monthly rise of 11.9 percent to 8.8 trillion lei last December. They were 71.5 percent higher than at end-1995.
Residents' hard currency deposits accounted for 23.4 percent of end-1996 broad money, almost flat from November but up from 22.6 percent in 1995.
Year-on-year inflation was 56.9 percent last year, more than double the 1995 level of 27.8 percent.
ROMANIAN MONEY SUPPLY DEC 96 NOV 96 DEC 95
